intro: Oxytropis cabulica, commonly known as Persian locoweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has hairy leaves and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Oxytropis cabulica is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
